Graham calls the book's tone`` characteristically tough and defiant'' as Donald Rumsfeld also criticizes Bush's shortcomings in resolving issues among senior advisers. Still, his barbs stop short of ad hominem attacks, and the memoir, even with its flashes of lingering resentment, maintains a measured tone. Wishes Bush Had Let Him Go Earlier In the book, Donald Rumsfeld explains that on two separate occasions after the story of Iraqi detainee abuse at Abu Ghraib broke out, he offered his resignation to the president. However, talk of the former Nicole Scherzinger 's possible arrival has apparently got Cheryl Cole worried she will be eclipsed by her if they do work together on the series. A source told the Daily Mirror newspaper: Cheryl Cole 's been straight with Simon Cowell but suddenly people aren't returning her calls. She doesn't want to get into a put-up scrap with Nicole Scherzinger with Simon Cowell playing the puppet master. Although he wants Nicole Scherzinger , Simon Cowell still hasn't made a final decision on the line-up and his stalling is said to be concerning TV chiefs who want the judging panel to be signed off.

To some, he's the potential candidate best able to unite two wings of the Republican Party-its fiscal conservatives and social conservatives. He is definitely the guy to watch, says Bryan Fischer of the American Family Association, a group that opposes gay marriage and abortion.
